head.citation-title: Color Random Valued Impulse Noise Removal Based on Quaternion Convolutional Attention Denoising Network
head.abstracts: 1070-9908 Â© 2021 IEEE.A new quaternion convolutional attention denoising network known as DeQCANet for color random-valued impulse noise removal is proposed in this paper. First, a structural information extraction block based on a dilated convolution operation is designed to extract the structure and detail feature map. Subsequently, a quaternion convolutional neural network with a new quaternion map construction strategy is implemented to gain the color features across channels further. Finally, to integrate the global and local features, a feature enhancement block based on the attention mechanism is proposed to guide the network for impulse noise denoising. The experimental results demonstrate that the proposed denoising technique exhibits competitive performance compared to other well-known color image denoising methods.

coredata.dc:description: A new quaternion convolutional attention denoising network known as DeQCANet for color random-valued impulse noise removal is proposed in this paper. First, a structural information extraction block based on a dilated convolution operation is designed to extract the structure and detail feature map. Subsequently, a quaternion convolutional neural network with a new quaternion map construction strategy is implemented to gain the color features across channels further. Finally, to integrate the global and local features, a feature enhancement block based on the attention mechanism is proposed to guide the network for impulse noise denoising. The experimental results demonstrate that the proposed denoising technique exhibits competitive performance compared to other well-known color image denoising methods.
coredata.dc:title: Color Random Valued Impulse Noise Removal Based on Quaternion Convolutional Attention Denoising Network
coredata.dc:publisher: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers Inc.
